summary: The conversation revolves around the power of podcasts and the limitations of mainstream media. They discuss the success of RFK and Vivek in utilizing podcasts to reach and engage with audiences. The main points raised include the constraints of mainstream media due to advertisement breaks and lack of time for in-depth discussions. There is also a lack of diverse perspectives in mainstream media, as hosts are limited by their networks' policies. The conversation also discusses Tucker Carlson's success in treating his television show like a podcast, but questions whether he has aspirations for politics or simply wants to continue with his profitable media career. They also touch on Tucker's ability to challenge narratives and influence opinions. The conversation veers toward the COVID-19 pandemic and the questionable decisions made by authorities regarding treatments and vaccinations. They highlight the banning of certain treatments and the profits made from promoting a single solution. The conversation concludes with a comment on the differing styles of podcasting and mainstream media, suggesting that some TV hosts may not find it easy to transition to the podcast format.
